model_input:
Your task is to choose a more helpful MEMORY based on the below criterion.

CRITERION:
Helpfulness - The MEMORY should contain sufficient quantity of useful information, enabling the Speaker A to respond in an appropriate context to the last utterance of the CURRENT DIALOGUE CONTEXT. PREVIOUS DIALOGUE SUMMARY is a summary of the previous dialog, and If the MEMORY contains information that conflicts with the PREVIOUS DIALOGUE SUMMARY, it is not helpful in that context.

The output format should be as follows:
Explanation: (a brief explanation)
Choice: (answer with "1", "2", or "tie")

Now choose the MEMORY that has better Helpfulness.

PREVIOUS DIALOGUE SUMMARY:
Speaker A moved from Alaska to their current location.
Speaker A enjoys programming and plans to go for a long run after work.
Speaker B has kids and enjoys watching movies with them.
Speaker B just turned 40 and considers themselves too old for certain activities.
Speaker A does not think 40 is old.
Speaker B has a sister who shares the same opinion about age as Speaker A.
Speaker B used to teach Film Studies and carefully chooses what movies to watch.
Speaker B enjoys watching suspense films, action, SF, horror, westerns, drama, and occasional good comedy.
Speaker B allowed their kids to watch Disney, Pixar, and older films like screwball comedies from the '30s and '40s.
Speaker B is not close with their sister and they have grown apart after their parents passed away.
Speaker B enjoys reading, playing music, watching movies, and hiking in their free time.
Speaker A used to hike in Alaska when they lived there.
Speaker A and Speaker B both enjoy steak dinners.
Speaker A prefers sirloin while Speaker B likes ribeye.
Speaker A likes peppercorn sauce and thick cut chips with their steak.
Speaker A prefers their steak cooked medium.
Speaker B enjoys their steak medium rare.
Speaker B recommends trying wagyu beef.
Speaker B aspires to live a luxurious life like a top of the range wagyu cow.
Speaker A is interested in watching movies, mentioned Pulp Fiction and Uma Thurman.
Speaker A relies on Speaker B for movie suggestions, mentioning a preference for comedies.
Speaker B is knowledgeable about movies and provides recommendations based on Speaker A's preferences.
Speaker B recommended "Coming 2 America" and "I-SPY" starring Eddie Murphy.
Speaker A enjoyed the movie "Coming to America" and expressed interest in watching its sequel.
Speaker A was disappointed with the movie "Showtime" starring Eddie Murphy and DeNiro.
Speaker B highlighted Eddie Murphy's success in cop roles in movies like Beverly Hills Cop trilogy and "I-SPY."

CURRENT DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: Okay, so, I watched Pulp Fiction, and I loved it! Thank you for the recommendation.
Speaker B: Of course. I recommend that movie to everyone I meet. I think I've watched it over one hundred times. So what is the next movie on your list to watch soon?
Speaker A: Yeah it was great and I will also recommend to people when they ask what movie is good. So next is another one you recommended which is coming to America. What’s the next movie your going to watch? 
Speaker B: There is a horror genre movie that was released just this week which I'm going to watch tonight. It is called "Girl Next."
Speaker A: Oh that sounds interesting, I will look into that and put it on my list. How has your job been going? Is there where you get all these great ideas for what to watch?  
Speaker B: My Film Studies professor job has been going absolutely great lately. I love all my students, because they really get into the lectures and ask lots of questions. Yes, my job requires me to watch movies all the time, so that is how I find the best ones. Is your programmer job going all right lately?
Speaker A: That sounds amazing. Super lucky to have students that really enjoy what they are learning about and I’m sure that’s down to the way you teach and what you teach them. I’m so glad it is all going well for you. Yeah it is going much better now, I’m really getting in the swing of things thank you for asking. 
Speaker B: You're welcome. So, returning to the subject of Pulp Fiction, did you think it was funny? Did you think it was too violent for kids to watch? 

MEMORY 1:
Speaker B, who used to teach Film Studies and carefully chooses what movies to watch, has a sister who shares the same opinion about age as Speaker A. Speaker A is interested in watching movies, mentioned Pulp Fiction and Uma Thurman. 
Speaker B, who has kids and enjoys watching movies with them, enjoys watching suspense films, action, SF, horror, westerns, drama, and occasional good comedy. Speaker B is knowledgeable about movies and provides recommendations based on Speaker A's preferences.
Speaker B, who used to teach Film Studies and carefully chooses what movies to watch, highlighted Eddie Murphy's success in cop roles in movies like Beverly Hills Cop trilogy and "I-SPY."

Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Movie Preferences', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker B shares about his love for movies and his viewing habits.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker A: So what kind of movies do you usually watch? ### Speaker B: Lots of different things. I used to teach Film Studies with a creative arts conservatory, so I chose what I watch carefully. I mostly follow the films of directors I like... ### Speaker A: Do you have any particular favorite genres? ### Speaker B: I like suspense films, action, SF, horror, westerns, drama, an occasional good comedy.... ### Speaker A: That's cool! Do you like to watch any movies with your kids? ### Speaker B: When the kids were young, they got Disney and Pixar of course, but I also let them watch older films, like the screwball comedies from the '30s and '40s. They just love them. They also have a good idea about film history too, something most kids don't have these days....' }(2) {'Related Topics': 'Movie Recommendations', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker B recommends movies like Pulp Fiction and Coming 2 America to Speaker A.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker A: Settling down now and thinking of watching a movie.  I'm leaning towards Pulp Fiction, have you ever seen it? ### Speaker B: Oh yes. It's a classic. It has so many great actors and actresses. The whole movie is amazing. Have you seen it before? ### Speaker A: No, I haven't. I think Uma Thurman looks so exotic though.  It just sounds like a very unique kind of movie. I'm not sure why I've never watched it before. ### Speaker B: Wow! I don't want to make you feel too bad for not seeing it after all this time. But I must encourage you to go see it as soon as possible! I can't spoil it for you. You'll love it! ### Speaker A: Thank you!  With your background, I bet you have a lot of great suggestions for movies, some of them fairly off the beaten path. I'll have to rely upon you for suggestions I think!  ### Speaker B: If you want more suggestions, just let me know! Just tell me what kind of movie you're looking for and I'll give you suggestions! ### Speaker A: I like all types of movies really. It mostly depends on the mood I'm in at the time.  I'm almost always in the mood for a good comedy though! ### Speaker B: Well then you gotta check out Coming 2 America! It has Eddie Murphy in it. I'd recommend seeing the Coming to America first if you haven't seen it. But the second one was just released within the year and is very funny! ### Speaker A: I did see the first one and I loved it! I didn't realize there was a sequel! I definitely have to put that on my list!  ' }
